analyzed: yon tan chen po //
translated: It is of great qualities,

original: rgya che ba'i yon tan 'byung ba ni mthong ba'i chos dang / 'jig rten pha rol du @345a *//🔽yang yin no //
analyzed: rgya che ba'i yon tan 'byung ba ni mthong ba'i chos dang / 'jig rten pha rol du @345a *//🔽yang yin no //

original: dad pa can gang zhig gis the tshom med par 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / the tshom med par rgyud 'di la brtson pa byed cing sngags sgrub pa dang / zlos pa dang / phyag rgya 'ching ba dang / rtag tu mngon par brtson par byed pa de la ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la yon tan gyi phan yon brgyad rab tu 'thob ste /
analyzed: dad pa can gang zhig gis the tshom med par 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / the tshom med par rgyud 'di la brtson pa byed cing sngags sgrub pa dang / zlos pa dang / phyag rgya 'ching ba dang / rtag tu mngon par brtson par byed pa de la ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la yon tan gyi phan yon brgyad rab tu 'thob ste /
translated: Whoever has faith in this tantra, who holds it without doubt, reads it, and without doubt strives in this tantra, accomplishes the mantra, recites it, binds the mudrā, and always strives in it, will obtain the eight qualities and benefits of the visible world.

original: 'khrul pa med par 'gyur ba dang / phyir rgol ba thams cad dang / dgra'i 'jigs pa 'di la mi 'byung ba dang / 'di'i lus la dug mi 'byung ba dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpas kyang 'di la byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ba dang /

translated: They will have long lives, enjoy happiness, and have youthful Mañjuśrī as their spiritual friend. They will see him every night in their dreams, and all mantras will protect them.

original: phyag rgya'ang 'di la rmi lam du ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya'ang 'di la rmi lam du ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mudrā will also appear to them in their dreams.

original: rgyal po ma rungs pa dang / sems can ma rungs pa dang / mi phan pa 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang gnod pa med par 'gyur ro; ;nges par byang chub la gzhol bar 'gyur ro //

original: khyim pa'am / rab tu @345b byung ba'am /

original: bud med dam /
analyzed: bud med dam /

analyzed: skyes pa'am / sems can chen po bstan pa la phan par byed pa rnams kyi yin gyi /

analyzed: sdig pa la zhugs pa gzhan gyi ni ma yin te /

analyzed: de las bzlog pa de'i 'gro ba ni du 'bod la sogs par skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: phyag rgya snga dro bcing bar byas nas tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one binds the mudrā in the morning, one will have a long life.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngags dang / 'khor gyi snying po dang; gtsug tor la sogs pa'i sngags dang / spyan la sogs pa gzhan gyi phyag rgya de bcing bar bya'o //
translated: This means that one should bind the mudrā of the mantra of the Tathāgata, the essence of the retinue, the mantra of the uṣṇīṣa and so on, and the mudrā of other deities such as Locanā.

original: yang na 'jam dpal gzhon nu khyod kyi phyag rgya bya ste /
analyzed: yang na 'jam dpal gzhon nu khyod kyi phyag rgya bya ste /

analyzed: 'di dag ni brtson 'grus dang / stobs mnyam pa yin no //
translated: These are equal in their diligence and strength.

original: gtsang zhing gtsang ma'i gnas su 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni gnas gtsang ma'i phyogs su zug rdu med pa'i gnas la ba'i lci bas la ma lhung bas byugs la me tog dkar po dri zhim po dag gis gcal bkram pa der 'dug la sngags bzlas shing phyag
analyzed: gtsang zhing gtsang ma'i gnas su 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni gnas gtsang ma'i phyogs su zug rdu med pa'i gnas la ba'i lci bas la ma lhung bas byugs la me tog dkar po dri zhim po dag gis gcal bkram pa der 'dug la sngags bzlas shing phyag
translated: Sitting in a pure and clean place means in a pure place, in a spot free of thorns, smeared with cow dung that has not fallen on the ground, strewn with fragrant white flowers, sitting there, reciting the mantra, making obeisance to the Tathāgata, the essence of the retinue, the uṣṇīṣa and so on, and other deities such as Locanā, and the mantra of youthful Mañjuśrī, one should recite the mantra.

original: rgya bcing bar bya yi /
analyzed: rgya bcing bar bya yi /
translated: One should bind the seal

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: and not otherwise.

original: gzhan dag tu ni phyag rgya dang lhan cig bzlas pa gcig kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu ni phyag rgya dang lhan cig bzlas pa gcig kyang mi bya'o //
translated: One should not do even one repetition together with the seal elsewhere.🔽As for what was said about “pure and pure,”

original: gtsang zhing gtsang ba zhes gang gsungs pa ni nyi ma nub pa na /
analyzed: gtsang zhing gtsang ba zhes gang gsungs pa ni nyi ma nub pa na /
translated: at sunset,

original: srog chags med pa'i chu gtsang mas khrus byas te /
analyzed: srog chags med pa'i chu gtsang mas khrus byas te /

analyzed: gos gsar pa bgos la gtsug tor gyi sngags kyis bsrung ba byas la grong gi chos rnam par spangs shing gtsang spra la dga' zhing dge ba /
translated: put on new clothes, perform protection with the uṣṇīṣa mantra, abandon the ways of the village, delight in cleanliness and virtue,

original: ske rags dkar po @346a *//
analyzed: ske rags dkar po @346a *//
translated: tie on a white belt,

original: bcings pa / de bzhin gshegs pa bsgoms la thun gcig 'das pa dang der nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcings pa / de bzhin gshegs pa bsgoms la thun gcig 'das pa dang der nyal bar bya'o //
translated: and, visualizing the Tathāgata, go to sleep there after one watch of the night has passed.

original: bram ze'i bu mo gtsang mas bkal ba'i skud pa blangs la sngags 'dis brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par sngags bar bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i bu mo gtsang mas bkal ba'i skud pa blangs la sngags 'dis brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par sngags bar bya'o //
translated: One should take a thread spun by a pure young brahmin woman and incant it one hundred and eight times with this mantra:

original: aom ha ra ha ra bandha ne shukra dh'a ra n'i siddh'a rthe sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom ha ra ha ra bandha ne shukra dh'a ra n'i siddh'a rthe sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ hara hara bandhane śukradhāraṇī siddhardhe svāhā.

analyzed: m'a ma k'i'i phyag rgya dang / bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: One should make the mudrā of Māmakī and recite the mantra.

original: de nas skud pa rked pa la lan gsum dkris nas bcing ba byas na sa bon bcing ba byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas skud pa rked pa la lan gsum dkris nas bcing ba byas na sa bon bcing ba byas par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, having wrapped the thread around one’s waist three times, one should bind it. The seed is bound.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug gis kyang rmi lam du yid la gnod pa byed par mi nus na rmi lam du log 'dren rnam pa sna tshogs kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos /

translated: If even the lord of desire is unable to harm one mentally even in a dream, what need is there to speak of various evil spirits in a dream?

original: de bzhin du cho ga 'dis 'dod chags dang ldan pas kyang mi nus na 'dod chags dang bral bas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de bzhin du cho ga 'dis 'dod chags dang ldan pas kyang mi nus na 'dod chags dang bral bas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: In the same way, if one who is passionate is unable to do so by this rite, what need is there to speak of one who is free of passion?

original: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug dga' ldan gyi bu mo gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs 'chang ba'i 'dod chags can gyis kyang yid la gnod pa skyed par mi nus na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug dga' ldan gyi bu mo gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs 'chang ba'i 'dod chags can gyis kyang yid la gnod pa skyed par mi nus na /
translated: If even the lord of desire, who is passionate and who assumes various forms of the daughter of Tuṣita, is unable to harm one mentally,

original: de las gzhan pa'i mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i bud med kyis kyang lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i bud med kyis kyang lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to speak of other human and nonhuman women?

analyzed: de lta bu'i cho gas nang bar langs la so shing bcas shing gdong rab tu bkrus la /
translated: Having risen at dawn in this way, one should chew the tooth stick and wash one’s face.

original: cho ga snga ma bzhin du srog chags med cing dri ma med pa'i chus khrus byas te /
analyzed: cho ga snga ma bzhin du srog chags med cing dri ma med pa'i chus khrus byas te /
translated: Having bathed with water free of living organisms and without odor, as before,

original: shar phyogs su bltas la phyag rgya bcing zhing sngags bzla ba byas na tshe ring bar 'gyur zhing las @346b thams cad la nus pa dang / nad chen po las grol te skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shar phyogs su bltas la phyag rgya bcing zhing sngags bzla ba byas na tshe ring bar 'gyur zhing las @346b thams cad la nus pa dang / nad chen po las grol te skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one should face east, bind the mudra, and recite the mantra. One will have a long life, be effective in all activities, be free from great illness, and be loved by all people.

original: dgra rnams kyang bshes gnyen nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra rnams kyang bshes gnyen nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even enemies will become friends.

original: mthong ba tsam gyis gdon thams cad dang / sha rjen za ba dang / sdig can la sogs pa rab tu 'byer bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam gyis gdon thams cad dang / sha rjen za ba dang / sdig can la sogs pa rab tu 'byer bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely seeing [the practitioner], all spirits, flesh eaters, and evildoers will be consumed by flames.

original: dgra rnams rengs par 'gyur ro //🔽mthong ba tsam gyis gtsang ba 'am /
analyzed: dgra rnams rengs par 'gyur ro // mthong ba tsam gyis gtsang ba 'am /
translated: Enemies will be paralyzed.

original: mi gtsang ba'i chogs las thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i chogs las thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely seeing [the practitioner], all activities will be accomplished with a heap of pure or impure [substances].

original: de bzhin du cho ga'i rgyal po 'di'i phyag rgya dang / sngags kyi tshogs kyi 'khor 'di yang grangs med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du cho ga'i rgyal po 'di'i phyag rgya dang / sngags kyi tshogs kyi 'khor 'di yang grangs med pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, the assembly of mudras and mantras of this king of rites is also immeasurable.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das grangs med pas gsungs pa dang / gsung ba yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das grangs med pas gsungs pa dang / gsung ba yin te /
translated: It has been and will be taught by countless blessed buddhas.

original: sh'akya thub pa ngas kyang da ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis kyang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi nang du gsungs te /
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa ngas kyang da ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis kyang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi nang du gsungs te /
translated: I, Śākyamuni, have also taught it now, in the midst of the maṇḍala assembly of the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly awakened buddha.

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nu /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nu /
translated: O Mañjuśrī,

original: khyod la yang bstan pa yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir dang / chos kyi dbyings yun ring du yang dag par bsrung ba'i phyir 'di khyod la yongs su gtad te //
analyzed: khyod la yang bstan pa yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir dang / chos kyi dbyings yun ring du yang dag par bsrung ba'i phyir 'di khyod la yongs su gtad te //
translated: I entrust this to you for the protection of the teachings and for the long-lasting preservation of the realm of phenomena.

original: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das te chos kyi de nyid la brten cing yang dag pa'i mtha'i tha mar gyur te zhi bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das te chos kyi de nyid la brten cing yang dag pa'i mtha'i tha mar gyur te zhi bar gyur pa na /
translated: When I have passed into parinirvāṇa, when the true nature of phenomena has been relied upon and the ultimate end has been reached, and when I have attained peace,

original: sems can snying rje chen po dang bral ba'i sems dang ldan pa la phan pa'i phyir gsungs shing /
analyzed: sems can snying rje chen po dang bral ba'i sems dang ldan pa la phan pa'i phyir gsungs shing /
translated: It was taught for the benefit of those beings who are devoid of great compassion.

original: dus kyi mtha' 'jigs pa chen po'i dus la bab pa na /🔽dkon mchog gsum la gnod @347a *//
analyzed: dus kyi mtha' 'jigs pa chen po'i dus la bab pa na / dkon mchog gsum la gnod @347a *//
translated: When the end of the eon, the time of great terrors, has arrived,🔽it was taught for the sake of averting those beings who harm the Three Jewels

original: pa byed pa'i sems can rnams kyang bzlog pa'i don dang / gdul ba'i don gyi phyir cho ga'i rgyal po 'di ngas gsungs la /
analyzed: pa byed pa'i sems can rnams kyang bzlog pa'i don dang / gdul ba'i don gyi phyir cho ga'i rgyal po 'di ngas gsungs la /
translated: and for the sake of guiding them.

original: rgya cher rnam par dbye bar byas na sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir yin no //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par dbye bar byas na sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir yin no //
translated: It was taught for the sake of all beings.🔽This king of manuals, the chapter on the extensive ritual of the bodhisattva collection,

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi rtsa ba'i cho ga byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod phal po che theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi rtsa ba'i cho ga byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod phal po che theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo las /
translated: the root manual of noble Mañjuśrī, the extensive sūtra of the Great Vehicle,

original: sngags dang / phyag rgya dang / nges par sdom pa dang / las dang / cho ga'i le'u rab 'byams las /
analyzed: sngags dang / phyag rgya dang / nges par sdom pa dang / las dang / cho ga'i le'u rab 'byams las /
translated: the chapter on the extensive ritual of the mantra, the seal, the vow, the rite, and the ritual,

original: sum cu rtsa gcig pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gcig pa rdzogs so ////
translated: is complete.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, Śākyamuni,

original: gzhan yang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i gnas gtsang ma'i gzhal med khang la gzigs nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur ba la bka' stsal ba /🔽'jam dpal / mdor na nyon cig /
analyzed: gzhan yang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i gnas gtsang ma'i gzhal med khang la gzigs nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur ba la bka' stsal ba / 'jam dpal / mdor na nyon cig /
translated: Furthermore, having looked at the entire pure realm of the Akaniṣṭha realm, he said this to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

original: phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid dang / sngags rnams kyi rgya che ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'i mdor bsdus pa dang; dam tshig la rjes su 'jug cing phyag rgya'i gnas dang / sngags thams cad dang / rgyud de dag thams cad la gsang ba dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor ni /

analyzed: ji ltar khyod smra ba dang / ji ltar khyod rab tu ston pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as you have explained and just as you have taught,

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: byang chub sems dpas bslab par bya //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas bslab par bya //
translated: the bodhisattva should train.

original: de bzhin du bsgrub par @360b bya; ;ji ltar sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang bstan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgrub par @360b bya; ;ji ltar sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang bstan par bgyi'o //
translated: Just as the buddhas and bodhisattvas possess great miraculous powers, so too will I demonstrate them.

original: don dam par ni yang dag pa'i mtha' las yang dag pa'i mtha' la yang dag par brten nas chos kyi mtha' las grol ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni yang dag pa'i mtha' las yang dag pa'i mtha' la yang dag par brten nas chos kyi mtha' las grol ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Ultimately, by relying on the limit of reality, one attains liberation from the limit of phenomena.

original: sems can mtha' ni bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: sems can mtha' ni bsam mi khyab //
translated: The limit of sentient beings is inconceivable.

original: rnam par smin pa'ang bsam mi khyab /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'ang bsam mi khyab /
translated: The limit of their karmic ripening is also inconceivable.

original: sangs rgyas chos kyang bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos kyang bsam mi khyab //
translated: The limit of the buddhas' qualities is inconceivable.

original: byang chub spyod pa'ang bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: byang chub spyod pa'ang bsam mi khyab //
translated: The limit of bodhisattva conduct is inconceivable.

original: gdul ba'i sems can la brten nas //
analyzed: gdul ba'i sems can la brten nas //
translated: Relying on sentient beings to be tamed,

original: phan pa'i spyod pa bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: phan pa'i spyod pa bsam mi khyab //
translated: The limit of beneficial conduct is inconceivable.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams //
translated: The conduct of bodhisattvas

original: bsam mi khyab par yongs su bstan //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab par yongs su bstan //
translated: Is fully taught as inconceivable.

original: rgyud rnams kun la rgyud 'di yi //
analyzed: rgyud rnams kun la rgyud 'di yi //
translated: In all tantras, the power of this tantra

original: mthu ni bsam mi khyab pa yin //
analyzed: mthu ni bsam mi khyab pa yin //
translated: Is inconceivable.

original: gshin rje gshed ni bdag nyid che //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed ni bdag nyid che //
translated: Yamāri is the great self,

original: khro bo'i rgyal po'i sngags dag dang // yul gsum dag kyang bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po'i sngags dag dang // yul gsum dag kyang bsam mi khyab //
translated: The mantras of the King of Wrathful Ones, and the three realms, are inconceivable.

original: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid bsam mi khyab //
translated: The nature of realization is inconceivable.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros //
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros //
translated: Śāntamati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i spyod pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i spyod pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: the conduct of bodhisattva mahāsattvas is inconceivable.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i sgrub pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i sgrub pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: The accomplishment that arises from the cause of the dharmadhātu is also inconceivable.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntamati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sngags zlos ba na 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /🔽'phags pa ma yin pa'i sems can 'dod pa la lhag par chags pas bsod nams ma yin pa shin tu rab tu @361a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sngags zlos ba na 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sems can 'dod pa la lhag par chags pas bsod nams ma yin pa shin tu rab tu @361a *//
translated: when a bodhisattva recites mantras, they should generate the following thought:🔽Non-ārya sentient beings, due to excessive attachment to desire, increase extremely abundant demerits

original: mang po 'phel bas dmyal ba chen por skye zhing sems can 'di dag ni bsod nams kyi phung po shin tu mang po 'di 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mang po 'phel bas dmyal ba chen por skye zhing sems can 'di dag ni bsod nams kyi phung po shin tu mang po 'di 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and are reborn in the great hells. These sentient beings will not increase such an abundant heap of merit.

original: sems can 'di dag byang chub rnam pa gsum gyis skal ba med par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag byang chub rnam pa gsum gyis skal ba med par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order that these sentient beings not be deprived of the three kinds of enlightenment,

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: the bodhisattva should, with a peaceful mind,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sngags zlos pas sems nye bar gzhag par bya zhing thabs mkhas pa 'di la mngon spyod kyis las rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sngags zlos pas sems nye bar gzhag par bya zhing thabs mkhas pa 'di la mngon spyod kyis las rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: recite the mantra. Thus, the bodhisattva who recites the mantra should establish the mind in this skillful means and apply the rite of wrath.

original: las thams cad la yang mtshan mar 'dzin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: las thams cad la yang mtshan mar 'dzin par mi bya'o //
translated: But he should not grasp at signs in any rite.

original: mi dge bar 'dzin par mi bya zhing snying rjes brlan pa'i sems kyis sems can gdul ba'i thabs la yang bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge bar 'dzin par mi bya zhing snying rjes brlan pa'i sems kyis sems can gdul ba'i thabs la yang bslab par bya'o //
translated: He should not grasp at nonvirtue, and he should train in the means of guiding sentient beings with a mind moistened by compassion.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Conqueror!

original: gzhan yang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / dkar po dang / nag po dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'gro ba'i bdag nyid chen po sems can gdul ba'i thabs sgrub pa dang // chos kyi dbyings sgrub pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / dkar po dang / nag po dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'gro ba'i bdag nyid chen po sems can gdul ba'i thabs sgrub pa dang // chos kyi dbyings sgrub pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the Bhagavat Buddhas have realized the Dharma, non-Dharma, white, black, virtue, non-virtue, the means of accomplishing the great self of beings, and the means of accomplishing the realm of phenomena.

original: de nyid chos ston bas sems can smin pa'i thabs kyang rab tu sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid chos ston bas sems can smin pa'i thabs kyang rab tu sgrub par byed do //
translated: By teaching the Dharma, they also accomplish the means of ripening beings.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O son of the Victorious Ones,

original: de bzhin du bdag cag gis bslab par bya zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag cag gis bslab par bya zhing /
translated: in the same way, we should train

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: in this way:

original: sems can gdul ba dang / sems can smin pa dang / bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / de la /
analyzed: sems can gdul ba dang / sems can smin pa dang / bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / de la /
translated: in order to guide beings, ripen beings, and teach them,

original: rgyal ba'i @361b sras khyed cag /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i @361b sras khyed cag /
translated: you, O sons of the Victorious Ones,

original: gang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'dir dam tshig chen po la zhugs pa de thams cad kyis mnyan par bya //
analyzed: gang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'dir dam tshig chen po la zhugs pa de thams cad kyis mnyan par bya //
translated: all who have entered the great commitment in this assembly of the mandala, should listen🔽with faith

original: dad par bya /
analyzed: dad par bya /
translated: and

original: de nyid dge ba dang / mi dge ba 'tshol ba nyid du bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nyid dge ba dang / mi dge ba 'tshol ba nyid du bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: He should investigate virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston pa la mngon par dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston pa la mngon par dga' bar bya'o //
translated: He should delight in the Tathāgata’s teaching of the Dharma.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhi ba'i blo gros kyis gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po lag na rdo rje la rnam par bltas nas cang mi smra bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhi ba'i blo gros kyis gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po lag na rdo rje la rnam par bltas nas cang mi smra bar gyur te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Śāntamati, having looked at the great yakṣa general Vajrapāṇi, became silent.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes yid la byas nas sangs rgyas la rnam par lta bzhin du rang gi stan la 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes yid la byas nas sangs rgyas la rnam par lta bzhin du rang gi stan la 'dug par gyur to //
translated: Thinking, “The Buddha’s Dharma is inconceivable,” he sat down on his own seat, gazing at the Buddha.

original: de nas gsang ba ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rjes thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de la rnam par bltas nas khro bo'i rgyal po'i cho ga yang smras pa /
analyzed: de nas gsang ba ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rjes thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de la rnam par bltas nas khro bo'i rgyal po'i cho ga yang smras pa /
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, Lord of Secrets, looked at the entire assembly and spoke the ritual of the king of wrathful ones:

original: gang dag lha'i tshogs dang / sems can gyi khams la brten pa'i 'byung po'i tshogs khyed cag nyon cig /
analyzed: gang dag lha'i tshogs dang / sems can gyi khams la brten pa'i 'byung po'i tshogs khyed cag nyon cig /
translated: “Listen, you hosts of gods and hosts of bhūtas that depend on the realm of sentient beings!

original: dang po re zhig bsrung ba byas la khro bo'i rgyal po'i ras ris de yongs su blangs la /
analyzed: dang po re zhig bsrung ba byas la khro bo'i rgyal po'i ras ris de yongs su blangs la /
translated: First, having made protection [rituals] for a while, one should take up that painting of the Lord of Wrath.

original: gnas dben par song nas dbang phyug chen po'i rtags gcig pa'i gnas su rtags de la dug dang / khrag dang / ske tshe dang / rang skyur gyis gtor la /
analyzed: gnas dben par song nas dbang phyug chen po'i rtags gcig pa'i gnas su rtags de la dug dang / khrag dang / ske tshe dang / rang skyur gyis gtor la /
translated: Having gone to a solitary place, in the abode of a single sign of Maheśvara, one should scatter on that sign poison, blood, black mustard seeds, and sour gruel.

original: shing pi tsu mar da'i me tog gis mchod cing mi'i rgyu ma rlon pa dag gis bdag nyid la mchod phyir thogs byas la /
analyzed: shing pi tsu mar da'i me tog gis mchod cing mi'i rgyu ma rlon pa dag gis bdag nyid la mchod phyir thogs byas la /
translated: One should worship with picumanda flowers, and one should wear a human entrail as a sacred cord.

original: mi'i @362a *// mgo bo'i thod pa g-yas pa'i lag na thogs pas brdegs pa lta bur byas la lag pa g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub kyis mtshan gcig po la sdigs ba bzhin du byed cing /
analyzed: mi'i @362a *// mgo bo'i thod pa g-yas pa'i lag na thogs pas brdegs pa lta bur byas la lag pa g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub kyis mtshan gcig po la sdigs ba bzhin du byed cing /
translated: Holding a human skull in one's right hand, one should act as if striking, and with the left hand one should threaten the single sign as if with a threatening gesture.

original: gtsor khro ba'i dbang du gyur pa dang / rgyal po ma rungs pas brnyas pa chen po'i sems kyis byas pa 'am /
analyzed: gtsor khro ba'i dbang du gyur pa dang / rgyal po ma rungs pas brnyas pa chen po'i sems kyis byas pa 'am /
translated: One should do this with a mind that is mainly overcome by wrath, or with a mind of great contempt for a wicked king.

original: gzhan skyon can gyi skyes bu phyogs chen po dang ldan pa dang / nor chen po dang ldan pa dang / rab tu gtum pa chen po dang / gtso bo chen po dag gis khyad du gsod par 'gyur na sgo bcad pa byas la gcer bur byas shing skra bshig pas dbang phyug chen po'i mtshan la khro bo'i sngags ji srid dbang phyug chen po'i mtshan dkyil du gas par gyur ba de srid du bzlas pa
analyzed: gzhan skyon can gyi skyes bu phyogs chen po dang ldan pa dang / nor chen po dang ldan pa dang / rab tu gtum pa chen po dang / gtso bo chen po dag gis khyad du gsod par 'gyur na sgo bcad pa byas la gcer bur byas shing skra bshig pas dbang phyug chen po'i mtshan la khro bo'i sngags ji srid dbang phyug chen po'i mtshan dkyil du gas par gyur ba de srid du bzlas pa
translated: If others, such as those with great faults, those with great wealth, those with great cruelty, or those with great power, despise him, he should shut his door, go naked, dishevel his hair, and recite the mantra of the wrathful Mahêśvara until the sign of Mahêśvara splits in the middle.

original: bya'o // dum bu gnyis su gyur na yi ge h'um gi sgra chen po yang thos par gyur te /
analyzed: bya'o // dum bu gnyis su gyur na yi ge h'um gi sgra chen po yang thos par gyur te /
translated: When it has split in two, he will also hear the great sound of the syllable hūṃ.

original: de la 'jigs par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jigs par yang mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be afraid of that.

original: de thos pa'i dbang gis rgyal po ma rungs pa'am /
analyzed: de thos pa'i dbang gis rgyal po ma rungs pa'am /
translated: By the power of hearing that, a wicked king

original: gzhan gang la la dbung chen po dang ldan pa'i dag de'i mod la rims chen pos zin par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan gang la la dbung chen po dang ldan pa'i dag de'i mod la rims chen pos zin par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or anyone else with great power will be seized by a great fever at that very moment,

original: srin po la sogs pa mi ma yin pas zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srin po la sogs pa mi ma yin pas zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: or will be seized by a non-human such as a rākṣasa.

original: de nyid ji srid yud tsam du bzlas pa byas na de'i mod la dgra rnams kyis 'tsho ba ni mtha' mar 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid ji srid yud tsam du bzlas pa byas na de'i mod la dgra rnams kyis 'tsho ba ni mtha' mar 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites it for just a moment, at that moment the enemy’s livelihood will be destroyed.

original: gal te mtshan mo bzlas na ni gza' 'khor dang bcas pa 'jig par @362b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mtshan mo bzlas na ni gza' 'khor dang bcas pa 'jig par @362b 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites it at night, the enemy will be destroyed along with his retinue.

original: gzhan yang / las su 'gyur ba ni de bzhin du dbang phyug chen po'i gnas su nyi ma phyed la song ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / las su 'gyur ba ni de bzhin du dbang phyug chen po'i gnas su nyi ma phyed la song ste /
translated: “Moreover, for the rite one should go at midday to the abode of Maheśvara,🔽worship with neem leaves, and fumigate with the incense of human flesh.

original: nim pa'i lo mas mchod cing sha chen po'i spos kyis bdugs la; ji srid dgra'i khyim du mes tshig pa'i bar du bzlas pa byas na dgra yang 'dar ba'i rims chen pos thebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nim pa'i lo mas mchod cing sha chen po'i spos kyis bdugs la; ji srid dgra'i khyim du mes tshig pa'i bar du bzlas pa byas na dgra yang 'dar ba'i rims chen pos thebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites until the enemy’s house is burned down, the enemy will be seized by a great trembling fever.

original: yang na khros pas bzlas pa ma btang zhing g-yas phyogs su rtags kyang yod na dgra de 'chi bar 'gyur zhing rigs rgyud 'jigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na khros pas bzlas pa ma btang zhing g-yas phyogs su rtags kyang yod na dgra de 'chi bar 'gyur zhing rigs rgyud 'jigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not stop the recitation out of anger, and there is a sign on the right side, the enemy will die and his family line will be destroyed.

original: ci ste slar gso bar byed na ni rtags de chus phyir yang rab tu bkrus la shin tu bsil ba'i 'o mas khrus byas na slar yang sos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste slar gso bar byed na ni rtags de chus phyir yang rab tu bkrus la shin tu bsil ba'i 'o mas khrus byas na slar yang sos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one wishes to revive them, one should wash the sign with water and bathe it with very cold milk.

original: las gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: las gzhan yang yod de /
translated: “There is also another rite:

original: dbang phyug chen po'i mtshan g-yas phyogs su bzhag la /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i mtshan g-yas phyogs su bzhag la /
translated: one should place the sign of Maheśvara on the right side

original: po son cha'i shing dang / tsher ma can gyi shing gis me rab tu sbar la /
analyzed: po son cha'i shing dang / tsher ma can gyi shing gis me rab tu sbar la /
translated: and light a fire with sticks of khadira wood and thorny wood.🔽One should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of sticks of pakṣa tree wood smeared with poison, blood, and black mustard seeds.

original: shing p'a kang ta ka'i yam shing la dug dang / khrag dang / ske tshe la mngon par btags la stong rtsa brgyad kyi sbyin sreg byas na dgra thams cad nad chen pos thebs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shing p'a kang ta ka'i yam shing la dug dang / khrag dang / ske tshe la mngon par btags la stong rtsa brgyad kyi sbyin sreg byas na dgra thams cad nad chen pos thebs par 'gyur te /
translated: All enemies will be struck down by a great illness

original: las thams cad kyis kyang nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las thams cad kyis kyang nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and will be unable to perform any rite.

original: zhag gnyis pa la ni rims nad chen po dang / zug gzer chen pos thebs pa 'am /
analyzed: zhag gnyis pa la ni rims nad chen po dang / zug gzer chen pos thebs pa 'am /
translated: On the second day, they will be struck down by a great fever and great pain,

original: nad rnam pa sna tshogs sam /
analyzed: nad rnam pa sna tshogs sam /
translated: or by various illnesses,

original: mi ma yin pas zin cing mthar 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi ma yin pas zin cing mthar 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or by spirits, and will eventually die.

original: zhag gsum pa la grangs gsum gyis @363a *//
analyzed: zhag gsum pa la grangs gsum gyis @363a *//
translated: If one performs the rite three times on the third day,

original: byas na ni 'tsho ba thams cad kyis thams cad du 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas na ni 'tsho ba thams cad kyis thams cad du 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one will be abandoned by all one’s livelihood and by everyone.

original: slar gso bar byed na ni'o ma'i sbyin sreg byas na zhi bar 'gyur zhing yul mi thams cad dang / dgra thams cad kyang sos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar gso bar byed na ni'o ma'i sbyin sreg byas na zhi bar 'gyur zhing yul mi thams cad dang / dgra thams cad kyang sos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one wishes to restore, one should perform a milk oblation, and all the people of the country and all the enemies will be pacified.

original: de bzhin du lha thams cad dam /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha thams cad dam /
translated: In the same way, one should perform the rite of trampling on the feet of any god,

original: ma mo thams cad dam /
analyzed: ma mo thams cad dam /
translated: any mother,

original: 'byung po thams cad gang zhig gang gi lha la dad pa de rkang pas mnan pa'i las bya ba 'am /🔽yang na de'i rgyu skar ram /
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad gang zhig gang gi lha la dad pa de rkang pas mnan pa'i las bya ba 'am / yang na de'i rgyu skar ram /
translated: or any bhūta, whatever they may be, who is devoted to a certain deity.🔽Or one should perform the rite of trampling on the feet of their nakṣatra,🔽mantra,

original: sngags sam / ming dag la rkang pas mnan la las byas te /
analyzed: sngags sam / ming dag la rkang pas mnan la las byas te /
translated: or name.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rig pa ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rig pa ni ma gtogs te /
translated: Except for the knowledge of the tathāgatas,

original: thams cad kyis kyang zhabs kyi mthe bong g-yon pa bzung ste las bya yi /🔽mnan par yang mi bya //
analyzed: thams cad kyis kyang zhabs kyi mthe bong g-yon pa bzung ste las bya yi / mnan par yang mi bya //
translated: all should be performed by grasping the left big toe and performing the rite.🔽One should not trample on it,

original: 'gom par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'gom par yang mi bya'o //
translated: nor should one step on it.

original: gang yang 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi sngags ni mnan nas las bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi sngags ni mnan nas las bya'o //
translated: All worldly mantras should be suppressed and used for action.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po'i bzlas pa ma grub pa nyid kyang bzlas pa tsam kho nas las rnams byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po'i bzlas pa ma grub pa nyid kyang bzlas pa tsam kho nas las rnams byed par 'gyur //
translated: Even if the king of wrathful ones is not accomplished, merely by reciting the mantra, all actions will be performed.

original: sngags thams cad rnam par 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: sngags thams cad rnam par 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: All mantras will be destroyed.

original: dgra thams cad 'joms par 'gyur //
analyzed: dgra thams cad 'joms par 'gyur //
translated: All enemies will be conquered.

original: sngags thams cad nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
